title: New movies and shows on Peacock, Paramount+ and Prime Video
description: Spinoffs of "The Office" and "NCIS" are among the new titles premiering this week.
content:
Here's what's new on Peacock, Paramount+, Prime Video, HBO Max, Hulu, Netflix, BET+ and Tubi.

What we're watching: A spinoff of an iconic comedy series, a new chapter in the "NCIS" franchise and a musical drama from the creators of "Outer Banks."

" The Paper ," available now on Peacock

State of play: The documentary crew that followed Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch turns its attention to a struggling Ohio newspaper in this spinoff of "The Office."

💭 My thought bubble: The show captures the spirit of its predecessor and does a decent job of portraying journalists, but these characters aren't as memorable as the ones we left at Dunder Mifflin.

" NCIS: Tony & Ziva ," available now on Paramount+

Catch up quick: The newest installment in the "NCIS" franchise picks up with the titular characters raising their daughter in Paris after Ziva's dramatic return from a supposed death.

Zoom in: After an attack on Tony's security company, the pair must go on the run across Europe and learn to trust each other again.

" The Runarounds ," available now on Prime Video

What's inside: Real-life artists William Lipton, Axel Ellis, Jeremy Yun, Zendé Murdock and Jesse Golliher star in this series about recent high school graduates pursuing a music career.

Behind the scenes: This show is produced by the creators of " Outer Banks " and, like the Netflix series, it's set in coastal North Carolina.

More titles

" Task " on HBO Max

Mark Ruffalo plays an FBI agent who leads a team organized to stop a string of violent robberies in the Philadelphia suburbs. Available Sunday

" Blood & Myth " on Hulu

This investigative true crime documentary is based on " Midnight Son ," an audiobook narrated by Alaska Native writer James Dommek Jr. Available now

" The Great British Baking Show " Season 13 on Netflix

An architect, a medical student and a bridal designer are among this season's contestants . Available Friday

" Rel Talk " on Tubi

From the What's Funny Comedy Festival in Chicago, comedian and actor Lil Rel Howery talks family, fame and man wigs in this new stand-up special. Available Friday

"Holy Hustle" on BET+

This film follows a rising star pastor who has an affair with an X-rated content creator who was formerly a devout churchgoer. Available now

" Countdown: Canelo vs. Crawford " on Netflix

Ahead of their bout on Sept. 13, boxers Canelo Álvarez and Terence Crawford show what life is like in and out of the ring. Josh Brolin narrates this docuseries in English and Diego Luna narrates in Spanish. Available now

" Betrayal: Under His Eye " on Hulu

This chapter of the "Betrayal" series follows a couple whose picture-perfect life together is shattered when a hidden camera in the family's home reveals dark secrets. Available now

" Dish It Out " on Prime Video

Gordon Ramsay's daughter Tilly hosts this cooking show featuring over 50 guests, including her parents, Frankie Grande, Jeannie Mai and Sistine Stallone. Available now

" Memphis To The Mountain " on Hulu and Disney+

A group of young rock climbers from Memphis takes on a 16,000-foot rock tower on Mount Kenya in this three-part documentary. Available Friday

keywords.name: Alaska Native writer James Dommek Jr.

summary: New movies and shows have been released on Peacock, Paramount+, Prime Video, HBO Max, Hulu, Netflix, BET+ and Tubi. These include a spinoff of "The Office" and a new chapter in the "NCIS" franchise. The documentary crew follows Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch and focuses on a struggling Ohio newspaper. The musical drama from "Outer Banks" stars real-life artists William Lipton, Axel Ellis, Jeremy Yun, Zendé Murdock and Jesse Golliher. The latest installment in the franchise follows the titular characters raising their daughter in Paris after Ziva's unexpected death. The Great British Baking Show, season 13 on Netflix, is based on an audiobook narrated by James Dommek Jr.
shortSummary: New movies and shows on Peacock, Paramount+, Prime Video, HBO Max, and Tubi include "The Paper," a spinoff of "The Office," and "NCIS: Tony & Ziva."
argos_summary: The article lists new streaming releases across Peacock, Paramount+, Prime Video, HBO Max, Hulu, Netflix, BET+, and Tubi, highlighting spinoffs of "The Office" and "NCIS", a musical drama from "Outer Banks" creators, and various other shows and documentaries. It details titles such as "The Paper", "NCIS: Tony & Ziva", "The Runarounds", "Task", "Blood & Myth", and others, noting their themes and key cast members. The piece serves as a guide for viewers looking to explore fresh content on multiple platforms.
